Name: Where to Find Gold in the Desert

ReviewList.Text: For all the aspiring young prospectors out there, or the old who need a new hobby that could pay for it self or anyone intrested in some wild west nostalgia should get this book. The author gives in depth detail of 9 desert gold bearing locations. Also included are areas of Nevada, Arizona and New Mexico. Treasure stories and great pictures are also included with this book, making it fun and easy to read. This book has ALL the information you need to begin looking for Gold in the Mohave desert. The book is well written, informative and a great addition to anyones library. I highly recommend it, either for yourself or as a gift, you won't be dissapointed!

The stories in this book are intertaining at most.  The areas discussed are mainly within indian reservations and state parks where it is illegal to prospect in most of them.  As for the indian reservations, they probably don't allow it either.  Although these area have been picked clean over the decades, I found it interesting to load up Windows Live Local or Google Earth to view the many map areas displayed in the book.

In the Nevada Desert there is Gold here and you don't have to go far, the Book basically talks about California, and other states besides Northern Nevada, but in general its a basic guideline for DESERTS in General and in this State you don't have to go far to find it, a metal detector, a little bit of dry panning and a whole lot of patience, and Dab nabit you can get Lucky too, happy Huntin.

Bought this when we were activly searching for the big nugget in CA. Helpful hints where and what to look for all over the deserts of the American Southwest from California, Nevada, Utah, Arizona and New Mexico. Did learn some secrets that we use today in AZ using our Gold Bug Pro.

The author tells stories of the location where gold was discovered in California.  There are no area descriptions that could contain gold in the desert.  The book tells lots of stories of old gold mines.  Not my kind of book
would recomend this to all new prospectors they can take there young families out to pan some  gold an have a fun outing. my kids alwayes liked going out.
If you're planning on looking for gold in the desert, this is a good book to have.  I'm glad I bought it.
Similar to my review of other books this type.  OK but turns out a little less than what you first expected.
Very informative and explicit information. thank you
I was very happy with my order Thanks.
this is a very informative text and i would most definately recomend it to anyone who is either just starting out, or just wants some fascinating reading

Good book that will get you motivated to look for gold. Lots of interesting stories on buried treasure and lost mines. One critique of the book is that even though the book is about the desert, he omits any information about Death Valley. He believes that one should be an expert on the desert before looking for gold and treasure in that part of the country. Readers would have been better served with a warning if he felt it necessary and then information on Death Valley. Overall a good read and something I will be referring back to for a long time for weekend excursions into the desert.

Like most books on this subject, this one is old and outdated and isn't really going to tell you where to find gold in the desert. It does have some interesting information but I'd suggest getting it from your library rather than buying it.
